No multiple events in last 7 years. â€¢ Lowest of 2 scores, middle of 3 scores. â€¢ The occupying borrower with the highest income is the primary borrower and their representative credit score is to be used. Credit Score o When borrowers are self-employed and have equal ownership of a business, the lowest representative score of all borrowers is to be used. o Minimum credit score for co-borrowers is 500. â€¢ Non-traditional credit ineligible. â€¢ Charge-offs or Collections acceptable if paid off over 12 months prior. â€¢ No delinquent tradelines at closing. Draw Period Restriction â€¢ No draws for 90 days after funding â€¢ 50% DTI â€¢ 45% with an I/O senior lien â€¢ US Citizen Eligible Borrowers â€¢ Non-Permanent Resident Alien (with US Credit) â€¢ Permanent Resident Alien â€¢ Not available in o Illinois o Massachusetts o Maryland Geographic Restrictions o New Jersey o New York o Pennsylvania o Tennessee o Texas o Vermont â€¢ 0x30x12 on all mortgages for all borrowers. Housing Lates â€¢ Minimum 12-month housing history required â€¢ Non-occupant co-borrowers Ineligible Borrowers â€¢ Vesting is not permitted to be in the name of an LLC, Corporation or Partnership A copy of the most current 1st mortgage statement is required to determine eligibility. Statement date to be within 60 days of Note date. Additional 1st mortgage documentation may be required to provide sufficient data for underwriting. â€¢ Private party mortgages â€¢ Loans in active forbearance or deferment o Deferred balance due to a documented hardship may remain open. Ineligible Senior Liens o Without documented hardship, deferred amounts must be paid through closing. â€¢ Negative amortization â€¢ Reverse mortgages â€¢ Balloon loans that the balloon payment comes due during the amortization period of the 2nd lien â€¢ Loan not reported on the credit report Minimum Loan Amount â€¢ $75,000 Senior Lien Payment Calc â€¢ 1st lien ARMS with < 3 years fixed period remaining qualified on fully indexed payment â€¢ SFR â€¢ PUD â€¢ Condo-Warrantable o 75% for O/O o 70% for Non-O/O Property Type â€¢ Modular â€¢ 2-4 Units max o 75% LTV for O/O o 70% for non-O/O â€¢ Rural â€“Primary residence, 10 acres maximum, max CLTV 80% 8 theSecond Matrix Effective Date: 05.12.25 Qualifying Payment â€¢ Qualifying ratios based on Full Note Rate Recently Listed Properties â€¢ Properties listed for sale in the last 6 months are not eligible â€¢ Ownership must be > 6 months seasoning Seasoning â€¢ â‰¤ 6 months seasoning since previous refinance on either 1st lien or 2nd lien max 80 CLTV Terms Available â€¢ Full Am: 10 yr, 15 yr , 20 yr & 30 year Title Report â€¢ Short ALTA - Lenders Policy â€¢ 3 tradelines reporting for 12+ months or 2 tradelines reporting for 24+ months all with activity in the last 12 months. Tradeline Requirement â€¢ On Primary residence only, borrowers who do not have the minimum tradelines are acceptable with a current mortgage history on their credit report reporting 0x30x12 (no private party mortgages). â€¢ Vesting as an individual or Living Trusts Vesting â€¢ Business Entities are allowed only on investment properties â€¢ Standard Fannie Mae Documentation â€¢ Salaried - 2 years W2 and YTD paystub reflecting minimum 30 days earnings. Full Doc â€“ 2 years â€¢ Self-Employed - 2 years tax returns, all schedules. o YTD P&L or o 3 months business bank statements to support continuance of tax return income. â€¢ NonQM o Alternative Loan Review Form or DU Approve/Ineligible finding. Full Doc â€“ 1 year â€¢ Salaried - 1 year most recent W-2 plus 30 days paystubs â€¢ Self-Employed - 1 year most recent tax returns plus either: o Borrower prepared YTD P&L o 3 months bank statements verifying cash flow (No P&L) â€¢ Personal & Business-Combined or Business (12mo or 24mo): o At least one of the borrowers must be self-employed for at least 2 years (25% or greater ownership) o Asset Depletion allowed with Bank Statement documentation o Standard expense factors apply: 50% expense factor â-ª If business operates < standard expense factor, P&L or expense letter from CPA, CTEC (California Tax Education Council), or EA (Enrolled Agent) required Bank Statements â-ª Minimum expense factor with 3rd party prepared P&L or letter is 20% â€¢ Personal & Business Separated (12mo or 24mo): o At least one of the borrowers must be self-employed for at least 2 years (25% or greater ownership) o Asset Depletion allowed with Bank statement documentation o Personal used to qualify, 2 months business to show business cash flows in order to utilize 100% of business-related deposits in personal account (no expense factor) â€¢ Most recent 1 year IRS Form 1099(s) from employer(s). Borrower must have 2 year history of 1099 employment. â€¢ Current paystub or bank statement deposit for each 1099 source utilized for qualification (e.g. if borrower provided 1099 forms from five (5) separate sources, then a separate paystub/bank statement deposit must be provided from each of the five (5) 1099 sources to support current receipt) 1099 â€¢ Third party documentation (CPA/CTEC/EA) supporting a 2 year employment history when 1 year 1099 used. â€¢ Tax transcripts are required for each 1099 provided â€¢ 1099 income minus 10% expense factor / 12 months = Qualifying Income. â€¢ Borrower cannot have ownership in the company providing the 1099 â€¢ Acceptable documentation forms o FNMA Form 1005 o Equifax (The Work Number) o Finicity (TXVerify) WVOE Only o Any other acceptable online income data vendor â€¢ 2 months personal bank statements supporting WVOE employment wages Form 1005 must be fully completed (current gross pay, YTD earnings, past 2 years earnings) by an authorized company representative (Owner, Officer, HR). â€¢ No other income documentation type other than Asset Depletion can be combined with the P&L for the self-employed borrower. P&L Only â€¢ At least one of the borrowers must be self-employed for at least 2 years (25% or greater ownership) to qualify for this program. â€¢ No 4506-C/tax transcripts/Tax Returns 8 theSecond Matrix Effective Date: 05.12.25 P&L Only Restrictions â€¢ The minimum expense factor with a P&L is 20% for service business, 40% for product business. o Service Business â€“ Offers services such as Accounting, Consulting, Counseling, Financial Planning, Insurance, Therapy. o Product Business â€“ Sells goods such as Contracting or Construction, Food Services, Manufacturing, Restaurant, Retail. Required Documentation â€¢ Business license for the past 2 years. â€¢ A signed letter from the CPA, CTEC (CA Tax Education Council) or EA (Enrolled Agent) on their business letterhead showing address, phone number, and license number is required with the following information: o CPA/CTEC/EA confirms they have prepared the most recent yearâ€™s business tax return filing; and, o The business name, borrowerâ€™s name, and percentage of business ownership by the borrower. â€¢ CPA/CTEC/EA signed/prepared Profit and Loss Statement(s) covering the most recent 12 month period. o PTINâ€™s are not acceptable to sign/prepare P&L statements. â€¢ Income from co-borrowers who are W2 wage earners is to be documented with most recent W2 and paystub.
